place_description:
Hartsell Funeral Homes began in the 1860s when Jacob Hartsell, a local cabinet and coffin maker, began offering funeral services to his community in Midland, North Carolina. What started as a way to serve his community, has branched into several other methods in which the Hartsell family helps to “Celebrate Life.” This coffee shop is dedicated to Jacob Hartsell and his hard work cultivating a family tradition of service to others.

We serve coffee, but we’re not your typical coffee shop. Inspired by Jacob Hartsell, we’ve created a space where ideas bloom and conversations flow. We’ve made a conscious decision to enjoy every moment life has to offer. Come and stay awhile. Enjoy the aroma of life!

reviews_data.review_text: I love this place. I usually go to starbucks or make my own drink but my daughter talked me into going here couple weeks back and I have went atleast 10 times now.. the staff is so great. I don't know the women's name but she is always there thru the week, but she is so friendly and awesome. The drinks r so great. The whole atmosphere is great. When I go, all I can think about is the next time I can go back. I stay all the way in Charlotte, 35 mins away, I will drive that far to go here
This was the best coffee I've ever had!! I wish this place was closer to me but I'll definitely be visiting anytime I'm in the area!!
Coffee is great as are Cinnamon muffins. Great staff. A little slow when very busy but understandable Still quicker than Starbucks and coffee is so much better.

We have been avid coffin house coffee connoisseurs for well over a year now. My daughter and I's absolute favorite place for an afterschool pick me up! The staff is very accommodating with requests for drinks, and extremely friendly. The Frappuccinos are my daughter's favorite, but I love the iced lattes!

Our favorite thing is the drink specials that change every month! We always look forward to seeing what drinks are available for each month!

Had my first visit at Coffin House Coffee Thursday. It's attached to a mortuary, so the name is so perfect! Delicious coffee as well as yummy cinnamon muffins. The staff were a pleasure to deal with. These guys are going to need a much bigger space because this one is first class

I've been wanting to stop here for a while - it's in such a unique location (sharing the building with an active funeral home) and they always advertise beautiful & creative drinks. I stopped by on my way through Concord and got an Americano - very simple but also easy to mess up. The girls working behind the counter took good care of me and made a great Americano at one of the cheapest prices I've seen recently! Extra bonus points for a hauntingly cool atmosphere - they do their marketing/branding very well!! I will definitely be back!
my favorite coffee spot i've found! everything about it is great.
Cute little coffee shop behind the funeral home. Very small with friendly service and a little merch section. Card only establishment. Coffee is very good, but on the sweeter side.

I went to the funeral  home not the coff house  so I can't  tell you about it  but it's  not something I would visit anyway  Hartsell makes  enough  money  from the grieving  families they serve   I can't tell  you my real feelings  about this place so I'll leave it alone

This place is fan freakinstastic! Love the vibes and atmosphere! It's attached to a funeral home which plays into the name. The lady's that help me were so kind and inviting. I'm here from Wisconsin and if I ever come back it will definitely be a forsure stop. Thank you!
Mothman was delish
By Far the best coffee I have had!! Love this place!
I didn't partake of their goods while there but my wife did. According to her the coffee was great and she loved the atmosphere of the place.

I decided to try a new coffee today and my experience was beyond amazing. The barista that made my chai was so sweet and kind, and she made the absolute best chai I've ever had!

After I got my drink, I went to start my car and found out my battery had died. That same barista had jumper cables in her car and pulled her car up for me to jump my car. She didn't have to do anything but she went out of her way for me and helped me out in my time of need.

This place has amazing drinks and employees. I would recommend this place over and over again. Give that barista a raise!
Lovely

Can't say enough good things about this coffee shop. The drinks are delicious, creative, and there are plenty of sugar free options. The barista is knowledgeable, sweet, and clearly has a passion for good coffee. I was picking up a few drinks while holding my 1 year old, and she offered to let me put my daughter in the car and carry my drinks out to me so I didn't have to try to juggle everything at once. Above and beyond customer service. I highly recommend Coffin House Coffee!
Coffee was great - they have lots of options.  They have limited indoor seating and lots of covered outdoor seating.
This place is Awesome!! The coffee drinks are great and the staff is Super nice and helpful!

Saw this place on Facebook a while back. I showed it to one of my coworkers and he said we have to go. We finally had time to check it out. We were both very pleased with the drinks, food, everything they had to offer. We will both definitely be back.

I'm always on the hunt for unique food and drink spots around Charlotte and beyond, so when I heard about a coffee shop located inside a funeral home in Concord, I knew I had to check it out. Yes, you read that right--Coffin House Coffee is the only one of its kind in the U.S., making it one of the most unusual finds I've come across. The curiosity alone was enough to get me in the car and on my way to see what this place was all about.

Before my visit, I did a little homework on their drink menu, and I was immediately intrigued. Their offerings are not just inventive but are regularly updated with creative seasonal specials that sound too good to pass up. I'm seriously considering making a bingo card to work my way through the entire menu!

On my first visit, I went for "The Coach" frappe, a drink that perfectly captures the nostalgic flavor of a peanut butter and jelly sandwich. Be warned, though--these drinks are sweet, but they're also absolutely delightful and refreshing.

I also had the pleasure of meeting the manager, Tawny, who is hands down one of the friendliest and most enthusiastic people I've met in the area. She's incredibly passionate about Coffin House Coffee, ensuring that every customer leaves completely satisfied. I witnessed her dedication firsthand when she stayed late to serve a mother and daughter who showed up just after closing. That kind of customer service is rare these days, and it left a lasting impression.

If you're looking for a unique coffee experience with top-notch service, make your way to Coffin House Coffee. They're open Monday through Friday from 7 AM to 4 PM and Saturday from 8 AM to 4 PM. You won't want to miss it!

the location is right up 601 and around a huge Atrium Health complex. I 100% stopped only because the name and asthetic lol but WOW this is some good coffee! They run specials with new flavors every month and are happy to customize whatever youd like. I highly recommend their cold brew! it has little to no acidity and a perfect balance of sweetness. They have non dairy options as well! There are some mini board games inside, seating outside, and a huge parking lot. Their restroom is very clean as well. Take the time to go here instead of Starbucks or Dunkin, you wont regret it!!
I got a Danish and I ate that danish

We previously passed this coffee place and thought,  what an interesting name.  Today we were headed to SC and took the route past this coffee shop.   My daughter researched their drinks and she said that it's in a funeral home.   I, of course, said what?  She told me again and I said that we definitely need to stop!  There was a hearse near the coffee shop door.   The place is small but unique.  The staff were very friendly and helpful.   We got the Lavender Hibiscus Lemonade and the Samoa Cookie Latte with Caramel Drizzle and Samoa Cookie Crumble (cold).  They were delicious and to die for!  Looking forward to coming back!
I love the coffin house for picking up or sitting inside to enjoy an afternoon brew. It is a unique place and always taste good.

This place had such good potential and vibes, but I felt like the staff was a little unpleasant.

The girl making coffee seems like it was more of a chore than actually being happy to serve a customer.

kind of ruined the experience . I felt like I was a nuisance there just trying to get coffee.

Absolute gem! Such a wonderful concept, and what a delight to see how they support their community.

The iced London Fog was excellent and the service was fantastic!
The first lady was super sweet. When I went on to get another latte.Thw lady who waited on me didn't seem to like me much the coffee was good.
It was amazing!!

Once you get over the initial shock that its by a funeral home, its similar in vibes to other coffee shops you'll visit. Read on the history and you'll see why the name fits. They have great Wi-Fi, Great Coffee, Lots of Variety from drinks like smoothies, lattes, frappes, and oh so yummy muffins and other treats!  I will say what sets them apart is its nice, quiet, but welcoming atmosphere to all who visit. I promise you, it won't be your last time coming. I can't wait to bring my daughter so she can try their Yoda Soda! She loves Baby Yoda! (They have star wars themed decor). Come visit your neighborhood Coffin House Coffee.

Moved here from Wilmington about a week ago and have been searching for a coffee shop to replace my old one. This place was absolutely amazing! Looooveeeeeee the theme! The coffee was amazing! The hearse in front just made it even more amazing. I do hope they make another location towards Charlotte as we drive a ways to visit them but it was worth it! Can't wait to come back.

My favorite coffee shop! I wish they weren't 2 hours away.  The drinks are so delicious, and the Beard Bakes treats are a nice complement to the coffee. Their current Alice in Wonderland specials are top-notch. We tried the Mad Hatter and Queen of Hearts today and we couldn't have been more satisfied.

Love the idea of a coffee shop in a funeral home, great way to celebrate life. I had the Grave Digger and the Mad Hatter and enjoyed them both! Chocolate chip cookie was great and the barista was very friendly

Important notice, this place does not take cash.

I've been here five times now.

It's a very tiny place, in the same building as a mortuary. What it lacks in space, it makes up for in coziness, honestly it's like a warm coffee scented hug. Everyone there will engage with you enthusiastically. There's a small selection of board games while you hang out.

Full disclosure, I'm a big fan of beard bakes baked goods (the strawberry buns are fluffy strawberry clouds sent DIRECTLY FROM THE HEAVENS ) and that's why I started going there.

The start of any coffee house is of course the coffee. The large Seattle chain tastes like it's burnt and thankfully that's not the case here. It's always smooth and flavorful. I did recently find a favorite (the vanilla latte)
Who wouldn't want to go to a coffee shop in a funeral home ? You never know what guests ( ghosts ) you may encounter . Cute clean fun place with tasty coffee and friendly service!!!
Though I never visited here I most diffinitly would, this is genius in so many ways many successful years to your business
Very nice coffee shop.  Stopped in while passing through town.  The staff was very friendly, service was fast and the coffee was excellent.  If I'm ever in the area again I would make this a stop.

Such a gem near the heart of historic Concord. Moved to the area about a year ago and found this sweet little coffee shop. My drink of choice is the Melody Mixup and of course my dog Racelyn loves to get her daily pup cups! Such a welcoming atmosphere with unbeatable coffee. It is tough when traveling out of town because nothing can compare to this local shop!
Such a lovely spot and great coffee!
Very Friendly staff and a great environment!
Very good coffee, great service, the barista was very nice and speedy. 10/10 recommended
My wife and daughters was great
I always receive the best service and even better coffee!

I had my first visit to Coffin House Coffee on 1/18/24. It is a small shop with 4 tables that has a unique theme and atmosphere which makes it stand out from other coffee shops. They have a variety of drinks that can be customized for different dietary needs. The staff was super friendly and helpful to any questions I had about the menu. They have WiFi you can use while staying there. They also have a variety of free games like chess, peg boards, and etc to play while staying here. I really enjoyed it. Bathroom was well kept up, had women products available for free, and super clean. A 10/10 for me. Will be returning to support this small business.
I have gone in about 5 times thinking it would get better. But customer service is lacking.
I like it. Friendly, good, and gets the job done. It's got a nice little history behind the shop.

Now this is something to be experienced!
Coffee was outstanding!!!!
Yes I said OUTSTANDING!
Staff was on point polite and attentive.
Atmosphere you have to experience for yourself one of a kind,if you just passing thru DEFINITELY make a stop here!
Everyone is so nice, the vibe is excellent and the coffee/pastries are superb! Hands down my favorite coffee shop.
Love it here! It's my favorite coffee shop in the area! I recommend it to everyone!
Great unique coffee shop
Awesome coffee and cookies.
Love this place my wife will die for this haha pun intended #CoffinHouseCoffee
Check this place out!!

Most creative specialties!!
Great staff
Halloween obsessed me meets coffee me! I love the setting and coffee !

I loved it so much I bought a shirt!
Best caramel frappe ever!
My newest favorite coffee shop! Lots of parking, wonderful coffee, great prices.
I love the coffee, especially the "Heaven on Earth" and "The Undertaker".
Such an awesome theme. Solid cup of Joe. 10/10 recommended.
They are the kindest people I've ever met. Their baked goods are amazing and the ever changing unique iced coffee has me hooked!
Cutest, spooky coffee shop in a family run funeral home. The Undertaker and Black and White Brownie were my favorites! I can't wait to come back and enjoy more.
love the coffin decor
Adorable lil shop that has quickly become my favorite go to
I went today for the first time, my coffee was GREAT, I just wish the cups were bigger, I'd definitely pay more for a large! :)
I love coming here. The coffee is to die for lol and the staff are wonderful.
Great coffee!!

I love everything about this place. The coffee is amazing. I've had just about everything on the menu and then some! The people who work there are absolutely the kindest and funnest people. The Beard Bakes food is always delicious.
I love the atmosphere of the shop. It's not a gothic style look. It's decorated very nicely and has photos and history of the funeral home. I hear a lot of "complaints" that this concept is very disrespectful and I personally don't think so. I've been a loyal customer since before they did their grand opening and the funeral home directors and employees as well as Coffin House employees are very kind, respectful, and caring people.

I support ALOT of small businesses in the Concord area but this is by far one of my favorites!
Coffee and (Beard Bakes of Concord) pastry here are quite good. Space itself has personality and is a part of local history. Check it out, and enjoy!
The Wookie
Great service and delicious coffee.
Lived everything here. The photos on the walls of the woodworking are lovely. And the coffee is delicious!
New slogan- Coffee for your Mourning!
Very chill coffee spot. Dracula himself would love how comfy it is.
This is a MUST for anyone in the area!!!  The coffee is so good and service is so good.  Don't be turned off by the locale, it's worth it.
We love coming to this coffee shop when we are in Concord. The atmosphere and staff are awesome but their coffee and pumpkin chocolate chip cookies are to "die" for.
The place was dead when i walked in.

This was randomly suggested to me as I had never heard of it.  What a cute surprise! The details in decorating were so funny.  The girls working were very nice.  I got the "Spirit Lifter" & I'm not big on sweet coffee drinks and this one was just right balance.  thank you C.H. for the suggestion!
Coffee was delicious and the staff was so friendly. I loved that they had little games (I.e tic tac toe) on the table if you want to hang out for awhile.
So unique!
Love it, great vibe

Couldn't figure out where they got the name until I pulled into the parking lot and only saw a funeral home. It's in the back. Friendly staff and decent coffee. Isolated location without other businesses around (except the funeral home).
This is such a cool place and really delicious coffee! Very friendly people! I didn't get a chance to try their baked goods but we'll definitely be back!
Went here about a week ago with my fiancee and had a decaf iced latte and some baked goods. All were very good and the customer service was great as well. Very friendly and inviting people.
Great coffee! Super friendly staff!
Amazing coffee and amazing workers. I love that they remember us and our kids and honestly take interest in their customers and getting to know them.
Super friendly customer service and the coffee is to die for! (Yes, pun intended. LOL)

A quaint coffee shop connected to a funeral home! The best coffee I've ever had in concord, and a great and welcoming atmosphere. They do have free wifi!

They have SO many different choices that are all super good so far and NOT BURNT! Yay!!

If you're ever in the area definitely try them out
There coffee is to die for
Had a "smokey" latte that was DELICIOUS! Definitely going back!!

I'm not a coffee hater, I'm just not one of those people that has to have it.  That being said, I'm in here at least once a week getting my Morning Glory (lavender & honey).  The staff has great energy and definitely take pride in their product.  The revolving selection of baked goods never disappoints. Bonus, somedays they even have an ice cream truck on site!
Very good drinks!!!

Today was my first time visiting Coffin House Coffee, I got the iced Almond Cupcake latte with oat milk and it's so delicious. I've also been so excited to try Beard Bakes bakery items and got the cookies and cream blondie and it's just as good as I thought it'd be buy the looks of their instagrams! More than anything I appreciate the back story of Coffin House, first I was shocked to see it was in the same building as Hartsell Funeral Home but the meaning behind wanting to give a mental break to people visiting the home and associating other memories with the funeral home is amazing, I really appreciate the caring thoughtfulness behind this business (:

Also! They use compostable straws! I love any business that tries to use less plastic
Really unique place and the iced coffee is very good!
Super customer service!!! A must visit !?
Grave digger was delicious!   Hands down very best cold brew I have had!   I chose heavy cream!   Was like drinking a creamy melted ice cream.
Wonderful baked goods and super nice folks. Next time I'll try the coffee

I tried to support them and go to them when they first opened..they didn't take cash..only cards..so they turned me away..Starbucks takes my cash when I order with cash..so I stick with them..I'm sure their coffee is great..but they turned my paper money away.. I will never go back..
Cute little coffee shop attached to a funeral home. They don't offer much in the way of food or pastries. The coffees were very good. There is an outdoor seating area as well.
Love it! One of my favorite coffee shops
No customer service and coffee was not what I ordered and barista didn't offer to make it right. She complained she had to make drip coffee?
Had a delicious iced coffee! Friendly staff and cute little spot to hang out. Pricing was much better than most coffee shops too so that was a definite plus!
Berry soothe was very good!
Super good coffee!

Would have loved to enjoy this cute coffee-shop but they do not accept cash and I couldn't use my credit card today. Was trying to purchase coffee for myself and take a coffee to my husband who works nearby. Be prepared before you go that they do not accept cash.
great vibes! loved hanging out here and the coffee's amazing!
Really nice coffee shop & excellent coffee.
Great coffee and great service. Highly recommend the Heaven on Earth.

wonderful environment, friendly staff, and delicious coffee!!
I got the white mocha frappuccino and loved every sip.
Best coffee, syd is a joy, terrific atmosphere 11/10 great place to go
Very cute thematic coffee shop set up next to a funeral home. Very clean, friendly baristas, lots of parking, and loads of creative drinks. Would 100% come here again!
What a neat place! I'm opening an office down the street and happened to find this place on Google. Excellent coffee. Thank you for carrying oat milk! I look forward to stopping by often!!

This coffee shop has hired the best manager in the business. I have been buying coffee from Sydney for the last 9 years. Great customer service, knows how to make the perfect Latte.
Everything is done with a smile and that keeps me coming back. She is like a grandaughter to me and my wife.
Easily the best coffee in the area. Very cute little shop off of Branchview, super convenient! Baristas are always so friendly, too.
Very good coffees and friendly and helpful staff.
